page.title: 11ATTITUDES
page.content: We did a survey of the views of people living in South Mimms and all the people we interviewed said they liked living there. Most gave us their chief reason, the QUIET rural ATMOSPHERE . The younger people also liked being fairly close to the shops in Potters Bar and being able to get to London easily.We also asked about the effects of the M.25 on the village. When the work first started there was concern amongst the villagers because of the noise & threats to the countryside.Now the construction is well under way most said they had come to accept it. They thought it would eventually ease traffic problems at Bignell's Corner roundabout and be useful for getting to the airports or round London to the coast.
